document_data.name: Change
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/60/More Cantrips: Mini-spells for apprentice magic-users|16}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Change''''' was a legerdemain [[cantrip]] that neophyte [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It temporarily altered one small animal into another or one small item made from vegetable matter into another.

Effects.Examples: Examples of typical transformations included changing a [[mouse]] to a [[mole]], a bird to a [[bat]], a [[rose]] to a [[firethorn]], or a piece of parchment to a square of cloth. Examples of radical transformations included changing a dead mouse to a live one, a bird to a [[flying squirrel]], a rose to piece of parchment, or a square of cloth to a [[tomato]]. Examples of minor transformations included changing a white mouse to blue, or a [[maple]] leaf to an [[oak]] leaf.

document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster spoke a magic word while passing a hand over the target object or creature.
